modules.description: This module provides access to vertical metric data from TrueType fonts, including ascent, descent, and line gap values. It works with the `Stb_truetype.vmetrics` type, which holds font-specific vertical layout information. Concrete use cases include calculating text height, aligning glyphs vertically, and determining line spacing for rendering text in graphics applications.

This module provides access to horizontal metric data for TrueType fonts, specifically retrieving the advance width and left side bearing values. It operates on the `Stb_truetype.hmetrics` type, which represents glyph spacing information. These values are used to calculate glyph positioning during text layout and rendering.

This module implements a buffer for handling raw byte data using Bigarray, specifically for working with TrueType fonts. It provides operations to create, access, modify, and slice typed arrays of unsigned 8-bit integers. Concrete use cases include reading and manipulating font file data at a low level, such as extracting glyph metrics or rendering text.

This module defines a box structure with integer coordinates and provides functions to access its corners. It works with the `Stb_truetype.box` type, representing axis-aligned bounding boxes. Use it to create and manipulate rectangular regions defined by their top-left and bottom-right points.

This module enables working with TrueType fonts by loading and manipulating glyphs, retrieving font metrics, and generating text bitmaps. It provides data types for fonts, glyphs, and buffers, and supports operations like glyph lookup, kerning adjustment, and text layout using horizontal and vertical metrics. Submodules handle low-level byte manipulation, define bounding boxes for regions, and extract font spacing data. Examples include rendering text at a given size, computing line heights, and positioning glyphs based on advance widths and side bearings.
